_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:28:37 using v2.0
title: How many elective operations have been cancelled and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: The total number of cancelled elective operations fluctuates over time from quarter to quarter, with peaks in Quarter 4 of nearly all the years that data have been collected. This is likely to be hospitals dealing with winter pressures. Overall, however, the trend shows that there has been a slight increase in the number of cancelled elective operations between Quarter 1 of 1994/95 and Quarter 2 of 2013/14. Figures from the latest quarter suggest that there are over 15,000 operation cancelled per quarter from a total of nearly two million elective operations performed.
